replication_study.hypothesis: Across countries, a one-point increase in the Economist Intelligence Unit Democracy Index (0–10 scale) is associated with a higher total number of confirmed COVID-19 infections per one million population (measured on 3 April 2020), controlling for average temperature and trade openness.

data_plan.source_type: Secondary compilation (ECDC case counts merged with Gapminder / World Bank indicators)

qualification.explanation: The file contains the same variables needed for the focal test (cases-per-million, democracy index, temperature, openness) allowing an independent re-estimation on a comparable but not identical sample.
qualification.similarity_to_original:
• Same data sources as the original (ECDC, Economist Democracy Index, World Bank trade) – stated in post_registration.json “source” field.
• Contains the same focal timeframe 31 Dec 2019–03 Apr 2020 (column COVID.12.31_04.03) referenced in the original study (initial_details.txt, post_registration.json).
qualification.deviation_from_original:
• Fewer countries (150 vs 163 in post_registration.json) which yields an independent sample.
• Democracy index supplied by Gapminder is on a 0–100 scale requiring division by 10, whereas the original used 0–10 direct scores (code comments in “Hossain 2020 - Replication Analysis.do”).
• Dataset also includes later time windows up to 11 Aug 2020, giving opportunity for additional robustness checks not in the original.

data_plan.notes: Variables ‘precipitation’ and ‘population density’ used as controls in the original are absent, so we follow the author’s final preferred specification that excluded them (see original paper p.13, replicated in the Stata do-file). Variable names use dots instead of underscores and include spaces, handled in code.

planned_method.steps:
1. Load the RDS dataset with pyreadr.
2. Rename key columns and choose the COVID.12.31_04.03 column as total cases.
3. Compute cases_per_million = total_cases / population * 1,000,000.
4. Convert Democracy index from 0–100 to 0–10 by dividing by 10.
5. Assemble regressors: democracy (focal), temperature, openness; add constant.
6. Estimate OLS with heteroskedasticity-robust (HC3) standard errors.
7. Save coefficient, SE, p-value, N to CSV for comparison.
planned_method.models: Cross-sectional OLS regression (cases_per_million ~ democracy + temperature + openness)
planned_method.control_variables: average annual temperature; trade openness (% GDP)

planned_estimation_and_test.test: t-test on β_democracy with HC3 robust SE

planned_method.missing_data_handling: List-wise deletion for any missing values in variables used.
planned_method.inference_criteria: Replicate claim if β_democracy > 0 and p < 0.05 (two-tailed). Magnitude will be compared to original 86.76467.

files.replication_data/replicate_hossain_democ: Loads RDS dataset, constructs variables, runs OLS with robust SE, prints summary, saves key replication results to /app/data/hossain_replication_results.csv

codebase.notes: Pure-Python implementation translating the provided Stata do-file. All file paths hard-coded to /app/data to conform with execution guidelines. Script reads DATASET_FLAG environment variable to optionally test later periods.

analysis.instructions:
From repository root inside the Docker container run:
python /app/data/original/3/python/replication_data/replicate_hossain_democracy.py
(Optionally set DATASET_FLAG=2 or 3 for robustness checks.)
analysis.comparison_metrics:
1. Sign of democracy coefficient (should be positive).
2. Statistical significance at α=0.05.
3. Magnitude compared to original 86.76 (absolute and percent difference).
